chargeHist.descr: 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide(939.05 PTAC)939.62(1)(c) Repeater)(939.63(1)(b) Use Dang. Weapon)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Davon M Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for zero days time served.
Consecutive to: to any other time

superMiscConds.notes: No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with Katrina K, Roxanne H, minor children, nor co actors Demetrius Robinson and Brandi Ollins.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Complete cognitive intervention program. Seek and maintain full time employment. Obtain HSED or GED.
Obtain Mental health assessment and take all prescribed medications.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--pay surcharge through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant; if sample previously on file, surcharge waived. 
Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

Defendant to pay restitution joint and several with Demetrius R.(14CF259) and Brandi O. (14CF258) $4,535.00 to Roxanne H. through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

Per order dated May 19, 2020, Appeal No. 2019AP963-W, IT IS ORDERED that the petition for writ of habeas corpus is denied, ex parte.
Per order dated May 19, 2020, Appeal No. 2019AP963-W, IT IS ORDERED that the petition for writ of habeas corpus is denied, ex parte.

Per order dated November 25, 2019, Appeal No. 2019AP963-W, IT IS ORDERED that, on or before December 16, 2019, Attorney Marcella De Peters shall file a written memorandum with this court stating whether, and if so how, she advised Mr.Thompson (1) of the court of appeals' June 13, 2018 decision, and (2) of his right to file a petition for review in this court.  The memorandum shall also state whether Mr. Thompson asked her to do anything following the issuance of the June 13, 2018 decision and what her response was to any such request.

per order dated June 4, 2019, Appeal No. 2019AP000963 W; IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee. This order waives only the filing fees in the Supreme Court. It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose. Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency.
Acknowledgment received from Court of Appeals receipt of Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus, Appeal No. 2019AP000963 W.

Per your Remittitur dated July 27, 2018, Appeal No. 2015AP002526 CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on June 13, 2018, that:   IT IS ORDERED that the Judgment of the circuit court is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Marcella De Peters is relieved of any further representation of Davon M. Thompson in this matter.   See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

HEARD IN BR 34 FOR BR 10
Defendant Davon M Thompson in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Davon M Thompson in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 45 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to any other time, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 30 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 years.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of extended supervision:
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Complete cognitive intervention program
-No contact with Katrina K, Roxanne H, minor children, nor co actors Demetrius Robinson and Brandi Ollins
-Obtain Mental health assessment and take all prescribed medications.
-Seek and maintain full time employment
-Obtain HSED or GED
Defendant to pay restitution joint and several with Demetrius R(14cf259) and Brandi O(14cf14cf258) $4,535.00 to Roxanne H through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

Defendant Davon M Thompson in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Davon M Thompson in custody.  Antoni J Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1:  COURT ORDERED PENALTY ENHANCERS REPEATER AND USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON DISMISSED.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 
AS TO COUNT 3:  On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT 3 DISMISSED AND READ IN.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 10.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-10-2014 at 08:30 am.
